shared.network

Interface SharedProxyServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProxyServer

    public interface SharedProxyServer
extends java.rmi.Remote

    This interface will be the server-side relay for receiving and making method calls from and to the client. Methods marked as Local are called by the client's proxy, while methods marked as Remote are called from the server towards the client.


    This interface extends Remote, to allow sending over RMI the references of implementations of this interface; thus, every method declared in it should also throw a RemoteException


    Since this is the server's proxy, every method signature will have a String uuid as first parameter, to identify the client on which the method should be called or the client which has called the method

    See Also:
    Remote, SharedProxyClient, ProxyServer, ProxyClient

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Boolean chooseWindow(java.lang.String uuid, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> windows, java.util.ArrayList<Cell[][]> matrices)
      Remote
      After the players have been collected in a waiting room before the match begins, the server sends each player four windows through this method; also, a matrix of Cell representing each window is sent, to allow procedural printing of them
      java.lang.Boolean chooseWindowBack(java.lang.String uuid, java.lang.Integer window)
      Local
      This method is called by a client which has chosen the desired window, while being held in the waiting room
      void enable(java.lang.String uuid)
      Remote
      Before each turn starts this method should be called on the client which should begin playing in the next turn
      void endTurn(java.lang.String uuid)
      Local
      This method is called whenever a players ends its turn through an interaction with the view
      java.lang.Boolean exitGame1(java.lang.String uuid)
      Local
      This method is called whenever a player quits the waiting room through an interaction with its view
      void exitGame2(java.lang.String uuid)
      Local
      This method should be called whenever a player quits the match through an interaction with the view
      void onTimeStatus(java.lang.String uuid, java.lang.String s1, java.lang.String s2)
      Remote
      Whenever the connection status of a player changes, this method should be called the other active players, in the same match; only one of the arguments will be passed at a time
      java.lang.Boolean ping(java.lang.String uuid)
      Remote
      This method should be called before each of the other remote ones, to check the client's availability
      java.lang.Boolean placeDice(java.lang.String uuid, java.lang.Integer index, Position p)
      Local
      This method should be called whenever a player wants to pick a dice from the pool and place it in his window.
      void printScore(java.lang.String uuid, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> nicks, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> scores, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> winner)
      Remote
      When a match ends, the server calls this method on all players who played that match, providing the names, score and winner flag for each player, as an ArrayList
      void shut(java.lang.String uuid)
      Remote
      Before each turn starts this method should be called on the clients which should not move during the next turn
      java.lang.String startGame(java.lang.String uuid, java.lang.String nick, java.lang.String ip, java.lang.Integer port, java.lang.Boolean isSocket, java.rmi.Remote stub)
      Local
      First method that SharedProxyClient should call towards the server: it will perform the registration of the player on the server, checking if he has already logged in or he was playing (and in case the player will join again his suspended match).
      java.lang.Boolean startGameViewForced(java.lang.String uuid)
      Remote
      If a player in the waiting room has not yet chosen its window and the timer for the room is up, this method is called on the player; also a window index is automatically chosen by the controller, for that player.
      void tavoloWin(java.lang.String uuid)
      Remote
      If all other players have left, this method is called on the only client left, ending the match with its victory
      void updateView(java.lang.String uuid, GameManagerT gameManager)
      Remote
      Server calls this method on every player's client, on every turn, to send the match status as a GameManagerT.
      void updateViewFromC(java.lang.String uuid)
      Local
      This method is called when a player asks the server to call the method SharedProxyClient.updateView(GameManagerT) on its client even if another player's turn has started
      java.lang.Boolean useToolC(java.lang.String uuid, java.lang.Integer i1, Position p1, Position p2, Position p3, Position p4, PositionR pr, java.lang.Integer i2, java.lang.Integer i3)
      Local
      This method should be called whenever a player wants to use one of the tool cards providing the correct parameters for that tool card.

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        java.lang.String startGame(java.lang.String uuid,
                           java.lang.String nick,
                           java.lang.String ip,
                           java.lang.Integer port,
                           java.lang.Boolean isSocket,
                           java.rmi.Remote stub)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Local
        First method that SharedProxyClient should call towards the server: it will perform the registration of the player on the server, checking if he has already logged in or he was playing (and in case the player will join again his suspended match). If socket RMI connection is being used, the parameter Remote stub is passed after NetworkRmi.remotize(Object, Integer) was called on its reference; otherwise it will be null
        Parameters:
        uuid - see SharedProxyServer for more about the first parameter
        nick - String
        ip - Integer
        port - Integer
        isSocket - Boolean
        stub - Object
        Returns:
        string of text representing the server response to the client's registration request
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyServer for more about this throw
        See Also:
        startGame(String, String, String, Integer, Boolean, Remote)

      • updateView

        void updateView(java.lang.String uuid,
                GameManagerT gameManager)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote
        Server calls this method on every player's client, on every turn, to send the match status as a GameManagerT.
        Parameters:
        uuid - see SharedProxyServer for more about the first parameter
        gameManager - shared element between client and server which contains all match data, updated before the last turn's start
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyServer for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyServer.updateView(String, GameManagerT)

      • chooseWindow

        java.lang.Boolean chooseWindow(java.lang.String uuid,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> windows,
                               java.util.ArrayList<Cell[][]> matrices)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote
        After the players have been collected in a waiting room before the match begins, the server sends each player four windows through this method; also, a matrix of Cell representing each window is sent, to allow procedural printing of them
        Parameters:
        uuid - see SharedProxyServer for more about the first parameter
        windows - numbers of the four windows received (between 1 and 24)
        matrices - matrices of Cell representing each window layout
        Returns:
        a Boolean value representing the success of the call
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyServer for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyServer.chooseWindow(String, ArrayList, ArrayList)

      • printScore

        void printScore(java.lang.String uuid,
                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> nicks,
                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> scores,
                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> winner)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote
        When a match ends, the server calls this method on all players who played that match, providing the names, score and winner flag for each player, as an ArrayList
        Parameters:
        nicks - list of player nicknames, alphabetically ordered (from 1 to 4 players can have played a match)
        scores - list of player scores, ordered with respect to nicknames
        winner - list of boolean flags, ordered with respect to nicknames (multiple players may have the winner flag set, if they have the same final score)
        uuid - see SharedProxyServer for more about the first parameter
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyServer for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyServer.printScore(String, ArrayList, ArrayList, ArrayList)

      • chooseWindowBack

        java.lang.Boolean chooseWindowBack(java.lang.String uuid,
                                   java.lang.Integer window)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Local
        This method is called by a client which has chosen the desired window, while being held in the waiting room
        Parameters:
        window - an Integer representing the chosen window; this must be contained in chooseWindow(String, ArrayList, ArrayList) second parameter, which holds the list of available window numbers
        uuid - see SharedProxyServer for more about the first parameter
        Returns:
        always returns true when the method call reaches the server
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyServer for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyServer.chooseWindowBack(String, Integer)

      • startGameViewForced

        java.lang.Boolean startGameViewForced(java.lang.String uuid)
                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote
        If a player in the waiting room has not yet chosen its window and the timer for the room is up, this method is called on the player; also a window index is automatically chosen by the controller, for that player. It will be notified about his window when updateView(String, GameManagerT) is called on it
        Parameters:
        uuid - see SharedProxyServer for more about the first parameter
        Returns:
        a Boolean value representing the success of the call
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyServer for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyServer.startGameViewForced(String)

      • placeDice

        java.lang.Boolean placeDice(java.lang.String uuid,
                            java.lang.Integer index,
                            Position p)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Local
        This method should be called whenever a player wants to pick a dice from the pool and place it in his window. Dices in the pool are addressed by an index between 1 and 9, and the position on the window is a Position
        Parameters:
        uuid - see SharedProxyServer for more about the first parameter
        index - index of the dice in the pool
        p - position of the destination position for thee selected dice on player's window
        Returns:
        always returns true when the method call reaches the server
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyServer for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyServer.placeDice(String, Integer, Position)

      • useToolC

        java.lang.Boolean useToolC(java.lang.String uuid,
                           java.lang.Integer i1,
                           Position p1,
                           Position p2,
                           Position p3,
                           Position p4,
                           PositionR pr,
                           java.lang.Integer i2,
                           java.lang.Integer i3)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Local
        This method should be called whenever a player wants to use one of the tool cards providing the correct parameters for that tool card. If one or more parameters are not needed by the selected tool card, they should be set to null; however, this method accepts every possible parameter that a tool card could need
        Parameters:
        uuid - see SharedProxyServer for more about the first parameter
        i1 - index of the selected tool card among the ones available from the GameManagerT that the server sent (an Integer between 1 and 12)
        p1 - first starting Position of a dice on the window
        p2 - first ending Position on the window
        p3 - second starting Position of a dice on the window
        p4 - second first ending Position on the window
        pr - dice PositionR in the round track
        i2 - dice index from the pool
        i3 - value to increment or decrement a dice
        Returns:
        always returns true when the method call reaches the server
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyServer for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyServer.useToolC(String, Integer, Position, Position, Position, Position, PositionR, Integer, Integer)

      • onTimeStatus

        void onTimeStatus(java.lang.String uuid,
                  java.lang.String s1,
                  java.lang.String s2)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote
        Whenever the connection status of a player changes, this method should be called the other active players, in the same match; only one of the arguments will be passed at a time
        Parameters:
        uuid - see SharedProxyServer for more about the first parameter
        s1 - will contain the nick name of the player who reconnected (in this case s2 will be null)
        s2 - will contain the nick name of the player who disconnected (in this case s1 will be null)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyServer for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyServer.onTimeStatus(String, String, String)
